page.title: 14HEALTH IN LITTLEPORT
page.content: There is a Health Centre in Granby Street, where there is a practice of {doctors.}Serious cases are taken to the RAF Hospital in Ely (5 miles) or Addenbrookes in Cambridge (25 miles). There is also a{dentist,}who sees 30 people per day, mainly doing fillings although she says her hardest job is to persuade people to clean their teeth properly. Children in both schools are visited by doctors, dentists,{opticians}and have vaccinations. Up to 100 people per day visit the{chemist,}most commonly for colds and 'flu, but cosmetics are also sold as well as medicines. {In the past,}fen men drank opium or poppyhead tea to keep off fever, wore eelskin garters to avoid rheumatism, put roasted onions in the ears against toothache and swallowed whole roast mouse to cure smallpox.
